intro: Licaria tikalana, commonly known as the Tikalana licaria, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
